predicate.note: Frames file for 'commit' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry, no comparison.

example.name: just transitive
example.text: The banks jointly committed $1.2 billion of financing, subject to certain conditions, McCaw said.
example.arg: $1.2 billion of financing, subject to certain conditions

example.name: passive with committed-to
example.text: ``This tells you AT&T is serious about continuing to manage their cost structure and is committed *trace* to 20%-a-year earnings growth,'' said Jack Grubman, an analyst with PaineWebber Inc.

example.name: passive often interpreted as ADJP
example.text: In an interview Wednesday with Dow Jones Professional Investor Report, Mr. Stevens said, ``We're in no way committed to a deal going through at all.
example.arg: a deal going through at all

example.name: but not always
example.text: He added the airline isn't committed *trace* to going forward with any new bid, and hasn't participated in bankers' efforts to revive the transaction that collapsed.
example.arg: going forward with any new bid

example.name: different sense, same syntax
example.text: Mary committed John to a mental asylum.

example.name: I am not a criminal!
example.text: Yesterday, U.S. Judge Alcee Hastings faced his jury -- the full U.S. Senate -- and said, ``I am not guilty of having committed any crime.''
